intro: Leptoglottis quadrivalvis, commonly known as the four-valved fern, is a species of fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, four-lobed fronds. The plant has a robust rhizome and produces spore-bearing structures called sori on the underside of its leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The leaves are typically leathery and have a unique, intricate venation pattern.
